description: Tesla's sales are down. It's slashing car prices and laying off staff. Yet CEO Elon Musk remains bullish on a future that's self-driving and battery-powered.
title: Tesla profits have plummeted. Elon Musk remains all-in on robotaxis

description: Trump is getting additional shares in his social media company, Trump Media & Technology Group, as part of his current agreement. He still can't cash in yet though.
title: Trump to score additional $1.2 billion windfall thanks to his Truth Social app

description: Two stories of how our reliance on GPS becomes problematic in regions experiencing war. In Ukraine, the power grid's use of GPS becomes a liability. And in the Middle East today, GPS "spoofing" causes a variety of issues from plane navigation to internet dating.
title: Scrambled GPS: the New Electronic Fog of War

description: "It was not like anything I had ever seen before," Alejandro Otero says. It turned out his home was hit by debris from the International Space Station that had been circling the Earth for three years.
title: A hunk of space junk crashed through a Florida man's roof. Who should pay to fix it?

description: An independent review commissioned by the United Nations did not have a mandate to investigate Israel's other claim that a dozen UNRWA employees took part in the Oct. 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel.
title: Report on UNRWA concludes Israel has not provided evidence of employees' militancy

description: The DOJ settlement goes to 139 victims of Larry Nassar, the disgraced team doctor of USA Gymnastics who sexually assaulted elite and Olympic gymnasts, after the FBI failed to promptly investigate
title: Justice Department pays $138 million over FBI failures in Larry Nassar case

description: After dozens of pro-Palestinian protesters were arrested at Columbia, Yale and NYU, students at colleges from Massachusetts to Minnesota to California are erecting encampments in solidarity.
title: Pro-Palestinian encampments and protests spread on college campuses across the U.S.

description: Tensions are high as campus protests over the war in Gaza stretch across the U.S. The Supreme Court will hear a case about pro-union Starbucks employees.
title: Gaza solidarity protests sweep U.S. colleges; SCOTUS tackles Starbucks union case

description: Starbucks and some of its baristas have been in a contentious fight over unionizing since 2021. Now, the Supreme Court is hearing a case that could have implications for unions far beyond Starbucks.
title: What the Starbucks case at the Supreme Court is all about. Hint: It's not coffee

description: Protests on college campuses related to the Israel-Hamas War have many Jews nervous heading into the holiday.
title: Concerns over antisemitism rise as Jews begin observing Passover

description: Critics say the U.S. has been unwilling to push for measures in a global agreement that would drive big cuts in plastic waste.
title: Talks for a plastic pollution treaty are stalling. Could the U.S. be doing more?

description: There's a referendum on abortion rights on the ballot in Florida in November. President Biden's campaign says that could help buoy his chances there.
title: Biden is campaigning in Florida a week before a new abortion ban takes effect

description: The arrests of the three middle schoolers came last month. Experts say young kids are increasingly exposed to hate ideologies, leaving communities to figure out how to respond.
title: 3 Maryland juveniles are charged with hate crimes. How did it get to that point?

description: The Federal Trade Commission will vote Tuesday on whether to issue a final rule banning noncompete agreements. The Biden administration has argued that noncompetes harm workers and stifle competition.
title: After 26,000 public comments, FTC to vote on rule banning noncompete agreements

description: Voting officials cheered when it was announced that a portion of a multibillion-dollar federal grant program would go to election security. But in many cases, the allocations didn't go as planned.
title: New federal grants aimed to support elections. Many voting officials didn't see a dime

description: David Pecker has previously cooperated with federal investigations into payments made to two women who were going to allege they had affairs with Trump ahead of the 2016 presidential election.
title: Ex-National Enquirer publisher testifies against Donald Trump in hush money trial

description: NPR's electoral map organizes states into seven categories – Toss Up, Lean Republican, Lean Democratic, Likely Republican, Likely Democratic, Safe Republican and Safe Democratic.
title: The states to watch on the 2024 electoral map
